summary: The document is a payroll certification for the U.S. House of Representatives' Select Committee on Assassinations, dated March 9, 1978. It details the salaries, positions, and employment periods for various staff members during the accounting period from February 1, 1978, to February 28, 1978. The document includes information on annual gross pay, period earned, and remarks for each employee, highlighting the diversity of roles within the committee, from senior counsel and staff investigators to clerical assistants and researchers.
key_findings: The payroll certification covers a wide range of positions within the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating a large and diverse team.
Salary limits for the period were set at a minimum of $1,200.00 and a maximum of $47,500.00, with the highest-paid individual being the Chief Counsel and Director.
The document provides insight into the organizational structure and staffing of a significant congressional committee during the late 1970s.
Notable positions include Chief Counsel, Deputy Chief Counsel, Staff Investigators, and various support roles, reflecting the committee's investigative focus.
